title: Kongxx
author: Kongxx
content: Is there official Binance acc on FB?

comments.author: TryNinja
comments.body: Yes.https://www.facebook.com/binancehttps://www.facebook.com/BinanceUSBoth are verified on Facebook and you can double check the authenticity of the first one on https://www.binance.com/en/official-verificationThe second one doesn't return a positive match, but that's probably just because it's related to their US branch (.us).

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: TryNinja on September 29, 2022, 05:56:33 AMYes.https://www.facebook.com/binancehttps://www.facebook.com/BinanceUSBoth are verified on Facebook and you can double check the authenticity of the first one on https://www.binance.com/en/official-verificationThe second one doesn't return a positive match, but that's probably just because it's related to their US branch (.us).Those are the official Binance account on Facebook. I think OP is looking for Binance.com Facebook account. About https://www.facebook.com/BinanceUS, I am surprised that it did not work, when I checked 'Binance.us', it worked. I think it is worth reporting this to Binance customer support.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: Oshosondy on September 29, 2022, 06:47:34 AMI think it is worth reporting this to Binance customer support.No need.Binance US only serves US-only customers with separate management from binance global (.com). And also all social media between these 2 entities won't be related to each other, will only verify their own property which is mentioned on their respective pages.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: rat03gopoh on September 29, 2022, 08:01:54 AMNo need.Binance US only serves US-only customers with separate management from binance global (.com). And also all social media between these 2 entities won't be related to each other, will only verify their own property which is mentioned on their respective pages.You did not understand what I am saying. Binance.us got verified. If binance.us got verified, why won't their official Facebook account not got verified too?

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: Oshosondy on September 29, 2022, 08:14:23 AMYou did not understand what I am saying. Binance.us got verified. If binance.us got verified, why won't their official Facebook account not got verified too?In my mind, it's not in global Binance's interest. Binance only shows the correct site to US customers because they've to be separate. And in fact, the person who controls the social account is under the command of a different superior in publishing the post or changing the account name.

comments.author: Kongxx
comments.body: Quote from: TryNinja on September 29, 2022, 05:56:33 AMYes.https://www.facebook.com/binancehttps://www.facebook.com/BinanceUSBoth are verified on Facebook and you can double check the authenticity of the first one on https://www.binance.com/en/official-verificationThe second one doesn't return a positive match, but that's probably just because it's related to their US branch (.us).The first one is inaccessible.

comments.author: TryNinja
comments.created_time: September 29, 2022, 04:10:25 PMLast edit: May 14, 2023, 02:16:45 AM by TryNinja
comments.body: Quote from: Kongxx on September 29, 2022, 04:01:58 PMThe first one is inaccessible. It's not, I just checked it again.And here is an archive I just made: https://archive.is/LW0t2

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: Oshosondy on September 29, 2022, 08:14:23 AMYou did not understand what I am saying. Binance.us got verified. If binance.us got verified, why won't their official Facebook account not got verified too?Because all the social media under binance.com are under the control of the ones that are doing the check, just as the binance.us domain is, the social media links under binance.us are under that team's control, so there is a simple explanation, if those accounts are not getting verified you can also decline responsibility for anything that happens with them, which would be totally normal for somebody to do since they don't actually control them.The real bug I see on that page is that things like https://www.binance.charity are not recognized but binance.charity is.
